Stan Laurel regarded PUTTING PANTS ON PHILIP as the first true' L&H film. THE SECOND HUNDRED YEARS was the first feature film and THE FLYING DEUCES the first Disney film, but PANTS was the only film featuring the ORIGINAL VERSION of the story, with a solid four (as opposed to three) chapters and featuring L&H in the first third.

Pierce Brosnan has sipped his last Martini and returns, in an outrageous self-parody, as the aging foul-mouthed boozy assassin Julian — a successor to Jack Ryan and Jason Bourne.
A toothless spoof, it’s loaded with tacky visual gags and hammed-up guffaws by Brosnan and Kristel Montero as his estranged daughter.
Their romance is supported by an insipid, overlong story with cheesy lines.

This is probably the only female Ninja movie ever made. It's great as a B film and the action sequences are a lot of fun to watch. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts our social history at the beginning of the Showa period when the ideological rule of Imperial Japan collapsed. This film also communicates a spiritual energy that the Japanese people held in that age, based on Miyazawa’s writings and artwork. Director and Cast Commentary Track
